content: Hello, I'm moving from CA to WA soon and I'm in the reserves. How do I find a list of all the reserve signal battalions in WA and where they are located, so I can contact them to see if they need my MOS (94E)? Thank you for any advice!
reply: Hello, I'm moving from CA to WA soon and I'm in the reserves. How do I find a list of all the reserve signal battalions in WA and where they are located, so I can contact them to see if they need my MOS (94E)? Thank you for any advice!
title: Moving to a new state and in the Army reserves

content: Don’t you have AKO? Or an “in-house” recruiter at old unit? BTW…who is “this member”? It’s generally considered polite to have some kind of profile so others may “know” whom is asking questions. Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!

content: 20903586, we'd like to get to know you please tell us something about yourself. You can do that in your bio! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
reply: 20903586, we'd like to get to know you please tell us something about yourself. You can do that in your bio! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
title: Moving to a new state and in the Army reserves

content: Your current unit should be able to transfer you to a unit in the area that has your MOS and needs your rank in a position. If they cannot help you, call a recruiting battalion in the WA area. You can find them all online. Get hold of the S-1 office. Retention is the key! If I was in the area I would help you out - but I'm clear across the U.S. - good luck!
reply: Your current unit should be able to transfer you to a unit in the area that has your MOS and needs your rank in a position. If they cannot help you, call a recruiting battalion in the WA area. You can find them all online. Get hold of the S-1 office. Retention is the key! If I was in the area I would help you out - but I'm clear across the U.S. - good luck!
title: Moving to a new state and in the Army reserves

content: “Rules…” I don’t think of them as rules, (if they even have rules about “this member” and profiles,) it’s just that most of us here would like to know who is on the “other end” of the conversation. And maybe avoid a spammer, “a tourist” or someone just here to get info on the US Military. I just tried to sign on to AKO and I guess the site is being blocked by my new virus protection…anyway, in AKO you can find what you need for PCS moves, units, etc. I can’t remember the link that I saw, but I know I was at least 4-5 links into AKO. I, for 2 of my units was an “in-house” recruiter. Basically I helped the actual recruiter/retention NCO (in Germany) with some of the paperwork, getting the “perks” for the Soldiers, and then getting the Officer to help with…”raise your right hand”. E-mail though mil.com and I will try and get the link for you… Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!

content: Thank you, everyone for the awesome responses! I'll try to go fill out my bio. Anyway, I'm a SPC4 in signals--radio/comsec repair. The company I work for in CA is handing out voluntary severances and I want to take one before I actually get "laid off" because now would be a good time for me to move and I've wanted to live in the NW for about 5+ years! Hopefully my screen name shows up sometime soon! I will certainly talk to retention at my next drill. Maybe that is what is meant by "in house" recruiter. I'll check my AKO for some leads too. I really appreciate the advice everyone!
